people_also_ask.question: Is Dance Dance Revolution still available?
people_also_ask.heading: Introduced in Japan in 1998 as part of the Bemani series, and released in North America and Europe in 1999, Dance Dance Revolution is the pioneering series of the rhythm and dance genre in video games. ... The series' current arcade version is Dance Dance Revolution A20 Plus, released on July 1, 2020.
people_also_ask.title: Dance Dance Revolution - Wikipedia

people_also_ask.question: How much does DDR cost?
people_also_ask.heading: Price was an issue as well: a new DDR cabine could cost about $15,000 - $17,000, almost double the price for a standard arcade cabinet which costs approximately $8,000 - $9,000.
people_also_ask.title: A Case History of the Success of Dance Dance Revolution in ...

people_also_ask.question: Is Dance Dance Revolution a good workout?
people_also_ask.heading: The 'No Barring' method of DDR play isn't quite as extensive of a work out, but it's still a great one. Using the core for stability and balance, legs for movement and holding body weight up, as well as the cardio inherently involved with any physical activity. ... All in all, DDR at any skill level is a great workout.20-Sep-2017
people_also_ask.title: DDR: The Best Workout You're Not Doing | Scholarly Gamers

people_also_ask.question: Will Dance Dance Revolution be on PC?
people_also_ask.heading: Konami has released Dance Dance Revolution V as a browser game for PC. It's in open alpha, so it's only got the basic features and 15 songs. ... According to the game's description, DDR V will work through Chrome, Edge, and Firefox, but not through Internet Explorer.14-May-2020
people_also_ask.title: Play Dance Dance Revolution V on PC for free | PC Gamer
